steps.56: Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)
steps.57: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
steps.58: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
steps.59: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone
steps.60: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
steps.61: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
steps.62: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle
steps.63: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds
steps.64: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)
steps.66: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
steps.67: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
steps.69: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug
steps.71: check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)
